content.description: A certain computer chip company has a machine that makes a large number of computer chips. Of the computer chips produced on this machine, <math alttext="3%" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mo>%</mo></math> are defective. Miriam, the quality control inspector, will randomly select computer chips from the machine to inspect.
content.question: What is the probability that the first defective computer chip Miriam finds is the sixth computer chip she inspects from the machine?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.03, close parenthesis to the fifth power, times 0.97" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>(0.03</mtext> <mrow> <msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mn>5</mn> </msup> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mn>0.97</mn> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </mrow> </math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.97, close parenthesis to the fifth power, times 0.03" overflow="scroll"> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>0.97</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>5</mn> </msup> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mn>0.03</mn> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
